title: Government Agreement visa (subclass 406)
raw_text: ===== main placeholder ========================================== ​This visa is closed to new applications. Government Agreement visa (subclass 406) Page Content ​​The Government Agreement visa (subclass 406) closed to new applications on 24 November 2012. You cannot apply for this visa. You might be able to apply for the Temporary Work (International Relations) visa (subclass 403) Visa Holders Details This information is for people who have already been granted a Government Agreement visa (subclass 406). It explains your rights and obligations. You can use Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO) for free to check your visa details and entitlements. What this visa lets you do Details This visa allows you to enter Australia either: under the terms of a bilateral agreement between Australia and another country to direct the operations of one of the following organisations: the British Council the Alliance Française the Goethe-Institut the Italian Cultural Institute. You can: enter Australia at any time do the work or activity specified in the relevant government agreement direct the operations of a listed company, if applicable bring your family with you to Australia enter and leave Australia while your visa is valid. Your obligations Details You and your family must comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws. During your stay in Australia, you and your family must: maintain adequate health insurance continue to meet the requirements of the visa you have been granted meet Australian taxation obligations if you work in Australia. While you are in Australia you must: not stop working or stop doing the activity that was listed in your visa application not work in a position or engage in an activity that is inconsistent with the reason for which your visa was granted only work for the employer listed in your application not work for yourself. Any member of your family who was included in your visa application must: continue to be part of your family unit enter Australia at the same time, or after you leave Australia at the same time, or before you. Tell us if things change Details Things you need to let us know about when you have this visa include: changes to your phone number, email, address or passport changes to your relationship status the birth of a child. See how to let us know if there is a change in your situation

# Government Agreement visa (subclass 406)

Government Agreement visa (subclass 406)
Page Content

​​The Government Agreement visa (subclass 406) closed to new applications on 24 November 2012. You cannot apply for this visa.

​​The Government Agreement visa (subclass 406) closed to new applications on 24 November 2012. You cannot apply for this visa.

You might be able to apply for theTemporary Work (International Relations) visa (subclass 403).

You might be able to apply for the
Temporary Work (International Relations) visa (subclass 403)
.

## Visa Holders

Visa Holders
Details

This information is for people who have already been granted a Government Agreement visa (subclass 406). It explains your rights and obligations.

This information is for people who have already been granted a Government Agreement visa (subclass 406). It explains your rights and obligations.

You can useVisa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO)for free to check your visa details and entitlements.

You can use
Visa Entitlement Verification Online (VEVO)
for free to check your visa details and entitlements.

### What this visa lets you do

What this visa lets you do
Details

This visa allows you to enter Australia either:

This visa allows you to enter Australia either:
- under the terms of a bilateral agreement between Australia and another country
under the terms of a bilateral agreement between Australia and another country
- to direct the operations of one of the following organisations:the British Councilthe Alliance Françaisethe Goethe-Institutthe Italian Cultural Institute.
to direct the operations of one of the following organisations:
- the British Council
the British Council
- the Alliance Française
the Alliance Française
- the Goethe-Institut
the Goethe-Institut
- the Italian Cultural Institute.
the Italian Cultural Institute.

You can:

You can:
- enter Australia at any time
enter Australia at any time
- do the work or activity specified in the relevant government agreement
do the work or activity specified in the relevant government agreement
- direct the operations of a listed company, if applicable
direct the operations of a listed company, if applicable
- bring your family with you to Australia
bring your family with you to Australia
- enter and leave Australia while your visa is valid.
enter and leave Australia while your visa is valid.

### Your obligations

Your obligations
Details

You and your family must comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws.

You and your family must comply with all visa conditions and Australian laws.

During your stay in Australia, you and your family must:

During your stay in Australia, you and your family must:
- maintainadequate health insurance
maintain
adequate health insurance
- continue to meet the requirements of the visa you have been granted
continue to meet the requirements of the visa you have been granted
- meet Australian taxation obligations if you work in Australia.
meet Australian taxation obligations if you work in Australia.

While you are in Australia you must:

While you are in Australia you must:
- not stop working or stop doing the activity that was listed in your visa application
not stop working or stop doing the activity that was listed in your visa application
- not work in a position or engage in an activity that is inconsistent with the reason for which your visa was granted
not work in a position or engage in an activity that is inconsistent with the reason for which your visa was granted
- only work for the employer listed in your application
only work for the employer listed in your application
- not work for yourself.
not work for yourself.

Any member of your family who was included in your visa application must:

Any member of your family who was included in your visa application must:
- continue to be part of your family unit
continue to be part of your family unit
- enter Australia at the same time, or after you
enter Australia at the same time, or after you
- leave Australia at the same time, or before you.
leave Australia at the same time, or before you.

### Tell us if things change

Tell us if things change
Details

Things you need to let us know about when you have this visa include:

Things you need to let us know about when you have this visa include:
- changes to your phone number, email, address or passport
changes to your phone number, email, address or passport
- changes to your relationship status
changes to your relationship status
- the birth of a child.
the birth of a child.
